intro: Micromeria brevicalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Micromeria brevicalyx is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky areas.
